intro: Achyranthes marchionica, commonly known as the Italian erythronium, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of yellowish-green flowers in early spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Achyranthes marchionica is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and delicate appearance.
